Content-Type: text/plain;
 charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Greetings,

As we port Cantera to new platforms, we sometimes note a few se=
t of changes
that need to be made to the Cantera code repository.

The late=
st issue, which we are noting during our Intel Mac builds, is
Cantera=B9s u=
se of cmath in c files (noted by myCFile.c). In reality, cmath
should only =
be used in C++ files, i.e., myCppFile.C. For c files, math.h
should be used=
. Although the c standard is expected to adopt the legal use
of cmath, the =
current c99 standard does not allow this usage.

Unfortunately, simply chan=
ging the name of the files from myCFile.c to
myCFile.C results in a large a=
mount of errors which seems to indicate use of
c-code that is not compatibl=
e with the C++ standard. I have not investigated
this issue to learn more. =
Our local approach has been to change cmath to
math.h.

Regards,

Stefan

--B_3279776218_10757085

 charset=iso-8859-1

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Incorrect of cmath header in c files</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<=
BODY>
<FONT FACE=3D"Verdana, Helvetica, Arial"><SPAN STYLE=3D'font-size:12.=
0px'>Greetings,<BR>
<BR>
As we port Cantera to new platforms, we sometimes =
note a few set of changes that need to be made to the Cantera code reposito=
ry.<BR>
<BR>
The latest issue, which we are noting during our Intel Mac bui=
lds, is Cantera’s use of cmath in c files (noted by myCFile.c). In re=
ality, cmath should only be used in C++ files, i.e., myCppFile.C. For c fil=
es, math.h should be used. Although the c standard is expected to adopt the=
 legal use of cmath, the current c99 standard does not allow this usage.<BR=
>
<BR>
Unfortunately, simply changing the name of the files from myCFile.c =
to myCFile.C results in a large amount of errors which seems to indicate us=
e of c-code that is not compatible with the C++ standard. I have not invest=
igated this issue to learn more. Our local approach has been to change cmat=
h to math.h.<BR>
<BR>
Regards,<BR>
<BR>
Stefan</SPAN></FONT>
</BODY>
</HTML=
>
